At The Local Catering, we specialize in crafting unforgettable moments that celebrate love, joy, and togetherness. With our seamless catering and event planning services, rooted in creativity and with a deep appreciation for diversity, we transform each event into a unique reflection of our clients' stories. From intimate gatherings to grand receptions, we blend culinary excellence with personalized design, aiming to exceed expectations every step of the way. Our focus on collaboration, integrity, and innovation ensures a stress-free celebration, creating timeless memories cherished for a lifetime. To learn more about our catering services, read below!                              Wedding & Rehearsal Dinner Catering   PLANNING YOUR BIG DAY  The Local’s experienced catering coordinators are here to make your catering experience a breeze. Here are some helpful starting points to consider when starting to plan your event : Decide on a catering and overall wedding budget. Pick a date and time of day for your big day. Estimate your guest count. Choose a venue (please see our recommended vendors for some great suggestions!). Determine your desired service style (check out our catering menu for pointers!). WHAT TO EXPECT WHEN YOU CHOOSE THE LOCAL:  First-Time Consultation: Our first meeting can be done by phone, email or in person at The Local. We will become familiar with your vision for your big day and what services you are interested in us providing. Customized Proposal: Following your initial consultation, we will customize your event proposal. Our proposals are “working proposals”, meaning we are happy to make changes for you until you are satisfied that we have met your vision. Contract: Once you are happy with your proposal we will secure your date with a deposit, and send you a contract confirming the details. Remember, even after signing a contract with The Local, we are happy to make changes and updates for you along the way! Coordination of Rentals: We will work with you to coordinate any rentals you will need for your big day. We work with several local rental companies who will bill us directly so you will only receive one bill at the end of the day. Venue Walk-Thru: A few months prior to your event date we will set up a walk-thru with you at your event venue. We will help go through your floor plan and any logistical questions that may arise. Final Steps: Approximately two weeks before your wedding, you and the catering coordinator will review and finalize all details. (Hannah Malloy Photography)                  Corporate & Special Events   PLANNING YOUR SPECIAL EVENT  The Local’s experienced catering coordinators are here to make your catering experience a breeze. Here are some helpful starting points to consider when starting to plan your event: Pick-Ups, Drop-Offs or full service events. Your coworkers are going to love you! Decide on a catering budget. Pick a date and time of day for your event. Estimate your guest count. Tell us where you plan to host your event, if you are looking for suggestions check out our recommended vendors. Determine your desired service style (check out our catering menu for pointers!). WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT IF YOU CHOOSE THE LOCAL:  Our catering offers full-service event planning. Our planners will work with you to make your vision become a reality. Our dedication to customer service will make your experience one of a kind.  If you’ve never hosted an event before we’re happy to make suggestions or provide some ready-made menu’s.  We encourage you to reach out to our coordinators to discuss ideas and we’re happy to walk you through how to make it happen! Customized Proposal: Our coordinators will customize your event proposal using one of our “ready-made” menu’s or you can build your own.  We’re happy work with any dietary restrictions and provide disposables for casual events.  Check out our Lunch Sample Menu for some ideas. Casual Lunch Sample Menu Fine Dining Dinner Sample Menu Pick-Up/Drop-Off Sample Menu Contract: Once you are happy with your proposal we will secure your date with a deposit, and we will send you a contract confirming the details. Remember, even after signing a contract with the Local, we are happy to make changes and updates for you along the way! Final Steps: Approximately two weeks before your event, you and the catering coordinator will review and finalize all details. We are happy to change any final counts and final rentals up to 14 business days prior to your event. We are happy to accept small catered events or drop-off/pick-up orders up to 72 hours before the event. metadata.title: How (and why) to reject wedding vendors — Planning with Poise

content: Wedding Planning for Busy People Home   About  Contact    Start Here   1. Budget  2. Set a Date  3. Guest List    Resources   Step-by-Step Guides  Proven Email Templates  Advanced Guide: ‘How to Hire Wedding Vendors’    Subscribe  » How (and why) to reject wedding vendors How (and why) to reject wedding vendors  December 13, 2017 by Katie   Last updated on January 14th, 2018 at 06:18 am Before I met my husband, I went on plenty of dates that went seemingly well, but the guy never called me back!  And then I was left wondering: Why?  What went wrong?  Should I call him?  Should I wait for him to call me?  If you can relate, then you know it’s not cool to be left in the dark like that.  That’s the same sort of thing that vendors go through when they don’t hear back from you.  Vendors are people too and the polite thing to do is to let them know where they stand.  Below, I’ll share some easy ways to let them down gently.  Why should you take the time to decline a vendor anyway?  The vendors you’ve contacted had to take time to consider your request, answer your questions, and prepare a quote for you.  Some may follow-up with you to make sure you have everything you need; some may continue to check in with you until they get an answer.  The polite thing to do is to respond to vendors because ignoring them is just plain inconsiderate.   It doesn’t take much effort to be polite and let them know where they stand – whether you’ve decided to hire a competitor, whether you’re still weighing your options, or whether you’re still shopping around.  Either way, it’s nice for them to know where they stand – and a quick email is all it takes.  And by the way, you won’t hurt their feelings if you decline their service.  In fact, you’re helping them close the loop on your request so that they can move on with their business.  You might also like this article:  How to email wedding vendors: My three-part template Declining a vendor could be the start of a negotiation  I’d like to share a brief story about how we sent a rejection email to a caterer for our wedding – and how we ended up hiring that caterer after all!  We requested estimates from about a dozen different caterers – using my email template for wedding vendors , of course!  We had a strong preference for buffet service (because it’s less expensive and we would eliminate the need to collect meal preferences from each guest – phew!).  One caterer actually charged more for buffet than plated service.  (That’s just weird!)  A few days later, they asked if we had made a decision yet.  We thanked them for their time and shared that we were considering other caterers who didn’t charge an extra fee for a buffet.  And guess what?  They offered to waive their additional fee for buffet service.  How cool is that!  If we had ignored their follow-up or refused to explain why we weren’t considering them, we would have never gotten this offer!  I share this story to illustrate that in some cases, it might be beneficial to let a vendor know why you plan to decline their services – it could be the start of a negotiation.  Word-for-word scripts to let your wedding vendors down gently  To make it a littler easier for you, here are a few word-for-word scripts that you use can use for each of the following situations:   If you’re still shopping around: “Thank you for the follow-up.  We’re still waiting to hear back from a few other vendors before we move forward with our decision.  We hope to update you soon.  In the meantime, please let us know if you have any additional information about your services.  Thanks again.”  If you’re still deciding: “Thank you so much for following up.  We’re still deciding between vendors, but we’re happy to say that you’re a top contender!  We hope to make our decision in the next several days.  We will update you soon.  Thanks.”  If you’ve hired another vendor: “We have decided to hire another vendor. Thank you so much for your time and attention.  All the best!”   You might also like this article:  Questions to Ask Wedding Venues Give it a try!  If you’ve been avoiding vendors because you’re not sure how to let them down politely, take the next two minutes to copy and paste an appropriate response from the list above.  And if you need help reaching out to vendors, feel free to use some of my email templates for shopping for wedding vendors.  Let me know if you’re interested in learning more about how to negotiate. We negotiated and saved nearly $15,000 for our wedding – I’d be happy to share how we did it.  <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:trackback="http://madskills.com/public/xml/rss/module/trackback/"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="https://planningwithpoise.com/reject-wedding-vendors/" dc:identifier="https://planningwithpoise.com/reject-wedding-vendors/" dc:title="How (and why) to reject wedding vendors" trackback:ping="https://planningwithpoise.com/reject-wedding-vendors/trackback/" /> </rdf:RDF>  Filed Under:  Reader Interactions   Leave a Reply Your email address will not be published. FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS      What is included in my catering delivery order?  Every catering delivery order comes with grated cheese, serving and eating utensils, table covers, plates, napkins and after dinner mints. Chafing dish, rack, and fuel are available upon request. Catering setup included for non-residential orders.       How far in advance do I need to place my catering delivery order?  Place your order before 5 p.m. for next day lunch delivery. You can also place your order well in advance of your event date.       How do I place my catering delivery order?  and pick your favorites with the ease and convenience of our desktop and mobile sites. Or you can call or visit your local Olive Garden and our dedicated Catering Specialist will be happy to guide you through menu selections and delivery details.       How many people would each pan serve?  Most of our a la carte catering pans serve 4 - 6 generous portions, and our Large Lasagna Classico pan serves up to 12. Make sure to check out our Catering Meal Combinations, each designed to serve 10 - 14 people a complete meal everyone will love, including dessert, salad, beverage and, of course, our delicious breadsticks!       Where do you deliver?  Start your order online to see if your event address can be serviced by one of our restaurants. We strive to deliver our food with the best quality and at the right temperature every time so we make sure that your food spends less time traveling and more time being enjoyed.       Can I pick up my catering order?  We offer both carside pickup and delivery services to meet your catering needs. You can order your favorite Italian Catering combinations online and pick up at an Olive Garden restaurant near you.       What size groups can you cater for?  We can handle anything from small to medium groups of 10 to 50 all the way to large occasions of several hundred people for your party or your meeting. We recommend placing orders online for events with 5 to 100 people - for larger groups call your local restaurant.       What is the minimum order for delivery?  The minimum order to qualify is $100 before taxes, coupons and 10% delivery fee.       Are your menu prices higher for deliveries?  We never mark up our menu prices for delivery. You pay the same for pickup or delivery and get the same abundant portions, food quality and value.       When is it appropriate to request chafing dishes and fuel?  For occasions where time between setup and service is extended or you have an event with a prolonged service, we recommend adding chafing dishes and warmers to your order to maintain food temperature. Also, chafing dishes are great when a higher level of presentation is wanted. Catering setup included for non-residential orders.      Join our eClub for news and offers! We’ll Bring The Party. At Sonny’s, we believe every event has its own flavor. Whether you’re planning a corporate event or a huge party with family and friends, you can’t go wrong with Sonny’s BBQ. With a versatile menu, genuine hospitality, and options to fit every budget, we’re here to transform your gathering into a memorable celebration. Sonny's BBQ Catering FAQs Answers to All Your Burnin’ BBQ Catering Questions FAQ 1 How much advance notice does Sonny’s BBQ require for catering orders? We like to be well-prepped for your shindig! Ideally, we’d appreciate a notice of at least 48 hours. This ensures your BBQ is fresh, flavorful, and right on time. FAQ 2 Can Sonny’s cater to dietary restrictions or preferences? Absolutely! Just let us know your specific needs, and we'll whip up something that'll have everyone at the table smiling. FAQ 3 Do you offer delivery and setup for catered events? You bet! We're here to make your event smooth sailing. We offer delivery, and our team can help with the setup so you can focus on enjoying your get-together. FAQ 4 What if I need to adjust or cancel my catering order? We get it, plans change. If you need to adjust or cancel, just give us a shout at least 24 hours before your event. We'll work with you to make sure everything's just right. FAQ 5 Can I customize my catering menu, or is it set? Your event, your rules! While we have some fan-favorite packages, we’re more than happy to mix and match to fit your vision. Let’s craft a BBQ spread that'll be the talk of the town. Discover Sonny's Art of BBQ Craftsmanship in Every Bite since ‘68 Our craft is steeped in tradition and a love for authentic, Southern-style BBQ. Discover the magic behind our signature slow-smoked meats and the tried-and-true techniques.
